title: Mac won't open League anymore â€“ "PowerPC applications no longer supported"
body:
(ok i realised that i posted this on the wrong board)

I just restared my MacBook cause my FPS was really low. When I tried to open League again my Mac told me that it could no longer open League beacuse "PowerPC applications are no longer supported." Im confused af can anybody tell me how to fix this?

replies.body: Which Mac are you running (year and model) and what version of macOS are you running? This could be caused by an incompatibility if your mac doesn't meet the [**minimum system requirements**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements/#section-mac).
I am using MacBook Pro (late 2008) but I still meet the minimum requirements. I played lol, than I needed to restart and since than I cannot play because of this message.{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

Yeah, so i think it's the new patch. i reported that to riot and they asked me for a lot of system check ups. 

but it's a patch thing for sure.

I'm having the same issue.  I was playing yesterday, and I then stopped playing and then tried to open again later that day and I got the message "PowerPC applications are no longer supported."  Very frustrated that I can't play when I literally played yesterday.
If you go back to the old client instead of the new beta client, that might work. Currently, installing this now to test this theory.
I can`t even run a LOL window so I reinstall LOL and I can't open it so I cannot choose to go back to old client.
I have the same problem. After restart I have got also this message.{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Mine just did the same thing. The newest patch might have screwed it up
